title: Profit Optimizer
description: Interactive visualization showing revenue, cost, and profit functions with controls to explore optimal production quantity, break-even points, and the MR=MC condition for profit maximization.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Calculus
Economics
Optimization
Business Mathematics
Marginal Analysis
learningObjective: Students will differentiate between revenue, cost, and profit functions, understanding how their relationships determine the optimal production level.

controls.name: Fixed Cost
controls.description: Fixed cost component of the cost function

controls.name: Base Price
controls.description: Price at quantity = 0 in the demand function

controls.name: Demand Slope
controls.description: Rate at which price decreases with quantity

controls.name: Explore/Challenge
controls.description: Toggle between Explore mode (all visible) and Challenge mode (profit hidden)

controls.name: Show Profit
controls.description: Toggle visibility of the profit curve

controls.name: Find Max Profit
controls.description: Jump to the optimal production quantity where profit is maximized
